alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 9:36PM MST until August 14 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HAVASU CREEK BASIN REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 933 PM MST, A stream gauge on Havasu Creek near the Colorado River north of Supai recorded a flash flood with a 5 foot rise at 830 PM MST. Flash flooding is occurring, but has already begun to recede. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Havasu Creek basin. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tapeats Creek, Colorado River, Deer Creek, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Havasu Creek, Little Coyote Canyon, Shinumo Creek and Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Havasu Creek basin. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
